fields.name: Annotation
fields.description:
Takes in a .vcf file and produces a .snp file.

Filters and combines the mutation data in .vcf file with data from 2 genome coordinate files (with headers) (one for coding regions and one for non coding regions) to add functional data.
fields.command_line:
module load gcc/6.2.0
module load perl/5.24.0
perl ${bin}flatAnnotatorVAR.pl ${h37rv}.fasta ${h37rv_coding}.txt ${h37rv_noncoding}.txt ${file}.vcf 15 0.1 PASS > @{file}.var

fields.name: Generate Matrix
fields.description: Takes in annotated var files and creates a matrix file from them used in predictions.
fields.command_line:
module load gcc/6.2.0
module load python/2.7.12
python ${bin}generate_matrix.py ${varient-names}.csv ${file}.var > @{file}.matrix.csv

fields.name: TB Predict (R1.2)
fields.description: A Random Forests predictor based on the matrix file.
fields.command_line:
module load gcc/6.2.0
module load R
Rscript ${bin}TBpredict.R ${file}matrix.csv
ls @{file}matrix.json

fields.name: Pair-Ended SAM Maker
fields.description: Use Stampy to turn two fastq files into a single sam file.
fields.command_line:
module load gcc/6.2.0
module load python/2.7.12-ucs4
/www/gentb.hms.harvard.edu/data/bin/stampy-1.0.28/stampy.py -g ${h37rv} -h ${h37rv} -o @{file}.sam -f sam -M ${file_one}.fast[aq] ${file_two}.fast[aq]

fields.name: BAM
fields.description: Turn a SAM file into a Binary BAM file.
fields.command_line:
module load gcc/6.2.0
module load samtools/1.3.1
samtools view -bS ${file}.sam > @{file}.bam
samtools sort @{file}.bam > @{file}.sorted.bam
samtools index @{file}.sorted.bam

fields.name: Quality Control
fields.description: Adds Quality data to a BAM file
fields.command_line:
module load gcc/6.2.0
module load samtools/1.3.1
samtools depth -b ${dr-regions}.BED -d 50 -Q 29 ${file}.sorted.bam | ${bin}qc_report.py > @{file}.qc

fields.name: VCF
fields.description: Use Platypus to create a Call Variant file from the indexed BAM file.

fields.name: Single-Ended SAM Maker
fields.description: Use Stampy to turn a fastq file into a sam file.
fields.command_line:
module load gcc/6.2.0
module load python/2.7.12-ucs4
/www/gentb.hms.harvard.edu/data/bin/stampy-1.0.28/stampy.py -g ${h37rv} -h ${h37rv} -o @{file}.sam -f sam -M ${file}.fastq
